name: Siberian Thrush
description: The male is slate gray-black with a white supercilium extending to the nape. Its underbelly is light with black markings. The female is brownish with a light underbelly and dark spotting.
spread_note: Breeds in Siberia, winters in Southeast Asia. Rarely strays to Europe.
food_note: Insects and their larvae, worms, fallen berries in autumn
image_alt: Siberian thrush, photo: Prague Zoo Archive
proportions: Body length 20–27 cm; wingspan 11–16 cm; weight 50–130 g
attractions: It lives discreetly, spending most of its time on the ground foraging. It builds its nest in dense undergrowth or bushes, up to 3 meters above the ground.
breeding: In 1997, a pair from the wild arrived, founding a successful breeding program. The male from that pair lived at the zoo until 2011.
